Tucson opens his clear blue eyes, even though he couldn't see anything thro=
ugh them. Through all his toughness he was actually a very nice guy with a =
lot of good spark in him.  He puts a hand on Talon's to let her know that y=
es, he's taking her advice and is very appreciative of her concern.

" I su=
ppose I - should have warned you what - I was like on the battle field.  So=
metimes - thinking outside the box works and - sometimes it doesn't.  In - =
this case, I - think it went both - ways. "

He shifts his weight while sit=
ting down.  Discomfort in his joints was now setting in.

" When - I starte=
d training as an Autobot, I did follow - the rules but sometimes I - would =
stray off from the normal routine.  Kup - called that wrecklessness with fi=
nesse. He - would jump down - my aft for it all  - the time.  I - simply - =
told him - old - habits - die hard." 

He chuckles lightly when he remember=
s his rookie days.

" Kup - would - lecture me - but - he said it wasn't an=
ything - against my fighting style.  It - was because I - was lucky enough =
- to be built with - surprisingly - good - looks and he didn't want me to g=
et too banged up or else - those damages could tarnish them."

Tucson wasn'=
t much for vanity as he chuckles the story off.

" I'd laugh it off of cour=
se.  To me - making - a difference for - the citizens of - Cybertron is far=
 more satisfying than - keeping up vanity.  Not - to mention a good run thr=
ough rugged outdoor terrain. That - also drove Kup crazy.  When I get mud o=
n - my windshield I get a big kick out of it."

He takes a few minutes to c=
atch his breath and gently squeezes Talon's hand to let her know he was sti=
ll with her.
